TopicTitle: Could it hold together on Eve with enough struts or am i mad?

Articles.Content: Hi, what are your thoughts to my 12k dV Eve Science Module Return Lander Design. Could it work or am I in a dead end?

I assume you are using the heavy struts from KW. It also looks like you only have 2 parachutes for that monster. and remember Eve has a higher gravity than Kerbin, so your Vessel mass is going to balloon. I would seriously consider replacing those landing legs with I-beams and strutting the crap out of that part of your craft (cause if that fails the whole thing will fail) I have zero experience coming back from Eve so take my advice with a grain of salt, but I don't think you're going to make it down before you make it up.
I don't see any lateral struts. This is going to fall apart like a bunch of trees cut down by a saw, and it will be spectacular.

I think that you could get away with a lot less rocket. Consider using 1.25m parts because the only thing that really matters is your dry-mass to empty-mass ratio and specific impulse. You can get 12k dV with a fraction of the size and then you won't need to worry too much about holding it together. Also, use struts very carefully because they cost a lot of dV so you only want as much as is absolutely necessary.

I think that you could get away with a lot less rocket. Consider using 1.25m parts because the only thing that really matters is your dry-mass to empty-mass ratio and specific impulse. You can get 12k dV with a fraction of the size and then you won't need to worry too much about holding it together. Also, use struts very carefully because they cost a lot of dV so you only want as much as is absolutely necessary.

It is my understanding that Struts are Massless in flight.

Also, use struts very carefully because they cost a lot of dV so you only want as much as is absolutely necessary.

Mass: 0.05. That is if they actually have mass outside the VAB/SPH display.

Considering how much the rest of any rocket weighs, that's next to to nothing. Either way, dV is a perfectly reasonable sacrifice for a rocket which won't fall apart instantly.

Contrary to the part desciption struts do not have effective mass.

Using Engineer or MJ the mass willl not go up, nor the delta v down when adding any amount of struts.
